citation.article-title: Description of Idiomarina insulisalsae sp. nov., isolated from the soil of a sea salt evaporation pond, proposal to transfer the species of the genus Pseudidiomarina to the genus Idiomarina and emended description of the genus Idiomarina

p.s: Description of Idiomarina insulisalsae sp. nov.

I. insulisalsae (in.su.li.sal'sa.e. L. n. insula, island; L. adj. salsus -a -um, salted; N.L. gen. n. insulisalsae, of a salted island, isolated from the Island of Sal [the salt island] in the Cape Verde Archipelago).
Cells are 0.8 μm in width and 1.6–2.4 μm in length.
Colonies on Marine agar are non-pigmented.
NaCl is required for growth; the NaCl range for growth is 1–12% (w/v), with optimum growth at 5% (w/v).
Optimum pH is approximately 7.5, with no growth below pH 5.5 or above pH 10.0.

The polar lipids pattern consists of the major polar lipids co-migrating on two-dimensional TLC with phosphatidylethanolamine, phosphatidylglycerol and diphosphatidylglycerol, three other minor phospholipids and one minor glycolipid.
Major cellular fatty acids are C15:0 iso (18.8%), C17:0 iso (16.6%), C17:1 iso ω9c (10.5%) and C16:1 ω7c (8.9%).
Nitrate is not reduced to nitrite.
Gelatine, arbutin, hippurate, DNA and Tween 20, 40 and 60 are hydrolysed, but starch, aesculin, casein, Tween 80 and urea are not.
Alkaline and acid phosphatase, esterase (C4), esterase lipase (C8), leucine arylamidase, trypsin, α-chymotrypsin and naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase are detected with API ZYM test strips.

Gentiobiose, d-mannose, formic acid, α-hydroxybutyric acid, α-keto butyric acid, propionic acid, d-alanine, l-alanine, l-alanylglycine, glycyl-l-aspartic acid, glycyl-l-glutamic acid, l-ornithine, l-proline, l-serine, d,l-carnitine and 2,3-butanediol are positive on Biolog GN2.
Acid was produced from d-fructose, d-ribose, l-sorbose, d-turanose, d-lyxose, d-tagatose and 5-ketogluconate.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 51.6 mol%.

The type strain CVS-6T was isolated from the soil of a solar saltern and has been deposited in the Collection of the Institute Pasteur, Paris, France, as strain CIP 108836T and in the BCCM/LMG Bacteria Collection, Ghent, Belgium, as strain LMG 23123T.
